intro: Restio micans, commonly known as the silver restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. Restio micans thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often found in dune ecosystems. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
